classes.name: BBxServletContext
classes.docu: In BBj 21.00 and higher, the BBxServletContext object provides a context during the execution of a BBxServlet. When a BBxServlet runs, it receives a BBxServletContext object as a parameter in its service method. The BBxServletContext object provides access to key elements of the BBxServlet and BBjServices, including the BBxServletRequest, BBxServletResponse, and BBxWebSession objects. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/BBxServlet/BBxServletContext/BBxServletContext.htm)

methods.name: getContextName
methods.docu: In BBj 21.00 and higher, this method returns the name of the BBjJettyContext the BBxServlet was added to. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/BBxServlet/BBxServletContext/BBxServletContext_getContextName.htm)

methods.name: getInitParameter
methods.docu: In BBj 21.00 and higher, this method returns the value of a given initialization parameter for the BBxServletContext.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/BBxServlet/BBxServletContext/BBxServletContext_getInitParameter.htm)

methods.name: getInitParameterNames
methods.docu: In BBj 21.00 and higher, this method returns a BBjVector of the Initialization Parameter Names for the BBxServletContext.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/BBxServlet/BBxServletContext/BBxServletContext_getInitParameterNames.htm)

methods.name: getJettyContext
methods.docu: In BBj 21.00 and higher, this method returns the BBjJettyContext object for the BBxServletContext.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/BBxServlet/BBxServletContext/BBxServletContext_getJettyContext.htm)

methods.name: getResponse
methods.docu: In BBj 21.00 and higher, this method returns the BBxServletResponse object for the BBxServletContext.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/BBxServlet/BBxServletContext/BBxServletContext_getResponse.htm)

methods.name: getRequest
methods.docu: In BBj 21.00 and higher, this method returns the BBxServletRequest object for the BBxServletContext.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/BBxServlet/BBxServletContext/BBxServletContext_getRequest.htm)

methods.name: getSession
methods.docu: In BBj 21.00 and higher, this method returns the BBxWebSession object for the BBxServletContext.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/BBxServlet/BBxServletContext/BBxServletContext_getSession.htm)

classes.name: BBxServlet
classes.docu:
In BBj 21.00 and higher, the BBxServlet class provides improved servlet functionality that was previously offered by BBjServlet and BBjspServlet. BBxServlets are designed to offer more intuitive deployment, better usage of licenses, improved error handling, and longevity of support, while providing all of the functionality of previous servlet implementations.
A BBxServlet requires a BBj source file with the following:

  • A public class that defines the servlet

  • A method in that class that returns void and takes a BBxServletContext as its only argument. This method is called the service method.
    • Note that in the examples below, this method is named service, but any valid method name would work.
To register a BBxServlet, you must also configure the following:
  • A URL mapping to provide access to the servlet
  • A config file for the servlet to use
  • A status indicating whether the servlet is enabled
See the BBxServlet Tutorial for a guide to the creation, deployment, and usage of BBxServlets. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/BBxServlet/BBxServlet/BBxServlet.htm)

methods.name: addParameter
methods.docu: In BBj 21.00 and higher, this method adds a parameter to the BBxServlet. Parameters can also be added via the Enterprise Manager under the "Parameters" section when creating or modifying a BBxServlet, or they can be added directly as <param> tags in the jetty.xml file. See the BBxServlet Tutorial for detailed information on adding parameters with these other methods. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/BBxServlet/BBxServlet/BBxServlet_addParameter.htm)

methods.name: clearParameters
methods.docu: In BBj 21.00 and higher, this method removes all custom parameters of the BBxServlet. It does not affect the standard parameters such as the servlet mapping, source file, SSCP, etc. It only removes parameters which appear in the jetty.xml as <param> tags. These parameters would have been added to the servlet via the BBxServlet::addParameter method, via the "Parameters" section in the Enterprise Manager when creating or modifying a BBxServlet, or directly as XML code in the jetty.xml file. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/BBxServlet/BBxServlet/BBxServlet_clearParameters.htm)

methods.name: getParameterNames
methods.docu: In BBj 21.00 and higher, this method returns a BBjVector of the names of all the parameters for the BBxServlet. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/BBxServlet/BBxServlet/BBxServlet_getParameterNames.htm)

methods.name: getParameter
methods.docu: In BBj 21.00 and higher, this method returns the value of the specified parameter of the BBxServlet. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/BBxServlet/BBxServlet/BBxServlet_getParameter.htm)

methods.name: getClassName
methods.docu: In BBj 21.00 and higher, this method returns the name of the custom class for the BBxServlet. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/BBxServlet/BBxServlet/BBxServlet_getClassName.htm)

methods.name: getConfigFile
methods.docu: In BBj 21.00 and higher, this method returns the absolute path to the config file for the BBxServlet. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/BBxServlet/BBxServlet/BBxServlet_getConfigFile.htm)

methods.name: getMapping
methods.docu: In BBj 21.00 and higher, this method returns the URL mapping for the BBxServlet. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/BBxServlet/BBxServlet/BBxServlet_getMapping.htm)

methods.name: getSourceFile
methods.docu: In BBj 21.00 and higher, this method returns the absolute path of the source file for the BBxServlet. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/BBxServlet/BBxServlet/BBxServlet_getSourceFile.htm)

methods.name: getTerminalAlias
methods.docu: In BBj 21.00 and higher, this method returns the terminal alias for the BBxServlet. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/BBxServlet/BBxServlet/BBxServlet_getTerminalAlias.htm)

methods.name: getWorkingDir
methods.docu: In BBj 21.00 and higher, this method returns the absolute path of the working directory for the BBxServlet. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/BBxServlet/BBxServlet/BBxServlet_getWorkingDir.htm)

methods.name: getMethod
methods.docu: In BBj 21.00 and higher, this method returns the name of the custom method for the BBxServlet. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/BBxServlet/BBxServlet/BBxServlet_getMethod.htm)

methods.name: getUser
methods.docu: In BBj 21.00 and higher, this method returns the user for the BBxServlet. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/BBxServlet/BBxServlet/BBxServlet_getUser.htm)

methods.name: isEnabled
methods.docu: In BBj 21.00 and higher, this method checks whether the BBxServlet is enabled. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/BBxServlet/BBxServlet/BBxServlet_isEnabled.htm)

methods.name: getClassPath
methods.docu: In BBj 21.00 and higher, this method returns the classpath for the BBxServlet. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/BBxServlet/BBxServlet/BBxServlet_getClassPath.htm)

methods.name: setConfigFile
methods.docu: In BBj 21.00 and higher, this method sets the config file for the BBxServlet. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/BBxServlet/BBxServlet/BBxServlet_setConfigFile.htm)

methods.name: setClassName
methods.docu: In BBj 21.00 and higher, this method sets the name of the custom class for the BBxServlet. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/BBxServlet/BBxServlet/BBxServlet_setClassName.htm)

methods.name: setSourceFile
methods.docu: In BBj 21.00 and higher, this method sets the source file for the BBxServlet. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/BBxServlet/BBxServlet/BBxServlet_setSourceFile.htm)

methods.name: setTerminalAlias
methods.docu: In BBj 21.00 and higher, this method sets the terminal alias for the BBxServlet. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/BBxServlet/BBxServlet/BBxServlet_setTerminalAlias.htm)

methods.name: setWorkingDir
methods.docu: In BBj 21.00 and higher, this method sets the working directory for the BBxServlet. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/BBxServlet/BBxServlet/BBxServlet_setWorkingDir.htm)

methods.name: setMethod
methods.docu: In BBj 21.00 and higher, this method sets the custom method used to service the BBxServlet. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/BBxServlet/BBxServlet/BBxServlet_setMethod.htm)

methods.name: setUser
methods.docu: In BBj 21.00 and higher, this method sets the user for the BBxServlet. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/BBxServlet/BBxServlet/BBxServlet_setUser.htm)

methods.name: setClassPath
methods.docu: In BBj 21.00 and higher, this method sets the classpath for the BBxServlet. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/BBxServlet/BBxServlet/BBxServlet_setClassPath.htm)

methods.name: enable
methods.docu: In BBj 21.00 and higher, this method marks the BBxServlet status as enabled. BBxServlets are enabled by default. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/BBxServlet/BBxServlet/BBxServlet_enable.htm)

methods.name: disable
methods.docu: In BBj 21.00 and higher, this method marks the BBxServlet status as disabled. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/BBxServlet/BBxServlet/BBxServlet_disable.htm)

classes.name: BBxServletRequest
classes.docu: In BBj 21.00 and higher, this class provides request information for a BBxServlet. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/BBxServlet/BBxServletRequest/BBxServletRequest.htm)

methods.name: getAttribute
methods.docu: In BBj 21.00 and higher, this method returns the value of a given attribute for the BBxServlet.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/BBxServlet/BBxServletRequest/BBxServletRequest_getAttribute.htm)

methods.name: getAttributeNames
methods.docu: In BBj 21.00 and higher, this method returns a BBjVector of the names of all the BBxServlet's Attributes.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/BBxServlet/BBxServletRequest/BBxServletRequest_getAttributeNames.htm)

methods.name: getAuthType
methods.docu: In BBj 21.00 and higher, this method returns the name of the authentication scheme used to protect the servlet.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/BBxServlet/BBxServletRequest/BBxServletRequest_getAuthType.htm)

methods.name: getBody
methods.docu: In BBj 21.00 and higher, this method returns the body of the BBxServletRequest.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/BBxServlet/BBxServletRequest/BBxServletRequest_getBody.htm)

methods.name: getCharacterEncoding
methods.docu: In BBj 21.00 and higher, this method returns the name of the character encoding used in the body of this request.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/BBxServlet/BBxServletRequest/BBxServletRequest_getCharacterEncoding.htm)

methods.name: getContentLength
methods.docu: In BBj 21.00 and higher, this method returns the length, in bytes, of the request body made available by the input stream, or -1 if the length is not known. For HTTP servlets, same as the value of the CGI variable CONTENT_LENGTH.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/BBxServlet/BBxServletRequest/BBxServletRequest_getContentLength.htm)

methods.name: getContentType
methods.docu: In BBj 21.00 and higher, this method returns the MIME type of the body of the request, or null if the type is not known. For HTTP servlets, same as the value of the CGI variable CONTENT_TYPE.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/BBxServlet/BBxServletRequest/BBxServletRequest_getContentType.htm)

methods.name: getContextPath
methods.docu: In BBj 21.00 and higher, this method returns the portion of the request URI that indicates the context of the request.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/BBxServlet/BBxServletRequest/BBxServletRequest_getContextPath.htm)

methods.name: getCookies
methods.docu: In BBj 21.00 and higher, this method returns a BBjVector of all the BBxServlet's cookies.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/BBxServlet/BBxServletRequest/BBxServletRequest_getCookies.htm)

methods.name: getDateHeader
methods.docu: In BBj 21.00 and higher, this method returns the value of the specified request header as a long value that represents a Date object.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/BBxServlet/BBxServletRequest/BBxServletRequest_getDateHeader.htm)

methods.name: getFileUpload
methods.docu: In BBj 21.00 and higher, this method returns the BBjFileUpload with the given name.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/BBxServlet/BBxServletRequest/BBxServletRequest_getFileUpload.htm)

methods.name: getFileUploads
methods.docu: In BBj 21.00 and higher, this method returns a BBjVector of all BBjFileUpload objects for the BBxServlet.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/BBxServlet/BBxServletRequest/BBxServletRequest_getFileUploads.htm)

methods.name: getFileUploads
methods.docu: In BBj 21.00 and higher, this method returns a BBjVector of all BBjFileUpload objects for the BBxServlet.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/BBxServlet/BBxServletRequest/BBxServletRequest_getFileUploads.htm)

methods.name: getHeader
methods.docu: In BBj 21.00 and higher, this method returns the value of the specified request header as a String. If the request did not include a header of the specified name, this method returns null. If there are multiple headers with the same name, this method returns the first head in the request. The header name is case insensitive. You can use this method with any request header.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/BBxServlet/BBxServletRequest/BBxServletRequest_getHeader.htm)

methods.name: getHeaderNames
methods.docu: In BBj 21.00 and higher, this method returns a BBjVector of all the header names for the BBxServlet.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/BBxServlet/BBxServletRequest/BBxServletRequest_getHeaderNames.htm)

methods.name: getHeaders
methods.docu: In BBj 21.00 and higher, this method returns a BBjVector of all the headers of the BBxServlet.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/BBxServlet/BBxServletRequest/BBxServletRequest_getHeaders.htm)

methods.name: getHttpServletRequest
methods.docu: In BBj 21.00 and higher, this method returns the underlying javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest object of the BBxServletRequest. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/BBxServlet/BBxServletRequest/BBxServletRequest_getHttpServletRequest.htm)

methods.name: getLocalAddr
methods.docu: In BBj 21.00 and higher, this method returns the Internet Protocol (IP) address of the interface on which the request was received.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/BBxServlet/BBxServletRequest/BBxServletRequest_getLocalAddr.htm)

methods.name: getLocale
methods.docu: In BBj 21.00 and higher, this method returns the preferred Locale that the client will accept content in, based on the Accept-Language header. If the client request doesn't provide an Accept-Language header, this method returns the default locale for the server.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/BBxServlet/BBxServletRequest/BBxServletRequest_getLocale.htm)

methods.name: getLocales
methods.docu: In BBj 21.00 and higher, this method returns a BBjVector of all the Locales of the BBxServlet.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/BBxServlet/BBxServletRequest/BBxServletRequest_getLocales.htm)

methods.name: getLocalName
methods.docu: In BBj 21.00 and higher, this method returns the host name of the Internet Protocol (IP) interface on which the request was received.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/BBxServlet/BBxServletRequest/BBxServletRequest_getLocalName.htm)

methods.name: getLocalPort
methods.docu: In BBj 21.00 and higher, this method returns the Internet Protocol (IP) port number of the interface on which the request was received.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/BBxServlet/BBxServletRequest/BBxServletRequest_getLocalPort.htm)

methods.name: getMethod
methods.docu: In BBj 21.00 and higher, this method returns the name of the HTTP method with which this request was made, for example, GET, POST, or PUT. Same as the value of the CGI variable REQUEST_METHOD.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/BBxServlet/BBxServletRequest/BBxServletRequest_getMethod.htm)

methods.name: getParameter
methods.docu: In BBj 21.00 and higher, this method returns the value of the parameter with the given name.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/BBxServlet/BBxServletRequest/BBxServletRequest_getParameter.htm)

methods.name: getParameterNames
methods.docu: In BBj 21.00 and higher, this method returns a BBjVector of the names of all the parameters of the BBxServlet.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/BBxServlet/BBxServletRequest/BBxServletRequest_getParameterNames.htm)

methods.name: getParameterValues
methods.docu: In BBj 21.00 and higher, this method returns a BBjVector of the values of all the parameters with the given name.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/BBxServlet/BBxServletRequest/BBxServletRequest_getParameterValues.htm)

methods.name: getPathInfo
methods.docu:
In BBj 21.00 and higher, this method returns any extra path information associated with the URL the client sent when it made this request. The extra path information follows the servlet path but precedes the query string and will start with a "/" character.
                                            This method returns null if there was no extra path information.
                                            Same as the value of the CGI variable PATH_INFO.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/BBxServlet/BBxServletRequest/BBxServletRequest_getPathInfo.htm)

methods.name: getProtocol
methods.docu: In BBj 21.00 and higher, this method returns the name and version of the protocol the request uses in the form protocol/majorVersion.minorVersion, for example, HTTP/1.1. For HTTP servlets, the value returned is the same as the value of the CGI variable SERVER_PROTOCOL.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/BBxServlet/BBxServletRequest/BBxServletRequest_getProtocol.htm)

methods.name: getQueryString
methods.docu: In BBj 21.00 and higher, this method returns the query string that is contained in the request URL after the path. This method returns null if the URL does not have a query string. Same as the value of the CGI variable QUERY_STRING.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/BBxServlet/BBxServletRequest/BBxServletRequest_getQueryString.htm)

methods.name: getRemoteAddr
methods.docu: In BBj 21.00 and higher, this method returns the Internet Protocol (IP) address of the client or last proxy that sent the request. For HTTP servlets, same as the value of the CGI variable REMOTE_ADDR.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/BBxServlet/BBxServletRequest/BBxServletRequest_getRemoteAddr.htm)

methods.name: getRemoteHost
methods.docu: In BBj 21.00 and higher, this method returns the fully qualified name of the client or the last proxy that sent the request. If the engine cannot or chooses not to resolve the hostname (to improve performance), this method returns the dotted-string form of the IP address. For HTTP servlets, same as the value of the CGI variable REMOTE_HOST.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/BBxServlet/BBxServletRequest/BBxServletRequest_getRemoteHost.htm)

methods.name: getRemotePort
methods.docu: In BBj 21.00 and higher, this method returns the Internet Protocol (IP) source port of the client or last proxy that sent the request.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/BBxServlet/BBxServletRequest/BBxServletRequest_getRemotePort.htm)

methods.name: getRemoteUser
methods.docu: In BBj 21.00 and higher, this method returns the login of the user making this request, if the user has been authenticated, or null if the user has not been authenticated. Whether the user name is sent with each subsequent request depends on the browser and type of authentication. Same as the value of the CGI variable REMOTE_USER.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/BBxServlet/BBxServletRequest/BBxServletRequest_getRemoteUser.htm)

methods.name: getRequestedSessionId
methods.docu: In BBj 21.00 and higher, this method returns the session ID specified by the client. This may not be the same as the ID of the current valid session for this request. If the client did not specify a session ID, this method returns null.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/BBxServlet/BBxServletRequest/BBxServletRequest_getRequestedSessionId.htm)

methods.name: getRequestURI
methods.docu: In BBj 21.00 and higher, this method returns the part of this request's URL from the protocol name up to the query string in the first line of the HTTP request. The web container does not decode this String.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/BBxServlet/BBxServletRequest/BBxServletRequest_getRequestURI.htm)

methods.name: getRequestURL
methods.docu: In BBj 21.00 and higher, this method reconstructs the URL the client used to make the request. The returned URL contains a protocol, server name, port number, and server path, but it does not include query string parameters.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/BBxServlet/BBxServletRequest/BBxServletRequest_getRequestURL.htm)

methods.name: getScheme
methods.docu: In BBj 21.00 and higher, this method returns the name of the scheme used to make this request, for example, http, https, or ftp. Different schemes have different rules for constructing URLs, as noted in RFC 1738.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/BBxServlet/BBxServletRequest/BBxServletRequest_getScheme.htm)

methods.name: getServerName
methods.docu: In BBj 21.00 and higher, this method returns the host name of the server to which the request was sent. It is the value of the part before ":" in the Host header value, if any, or the resolved server name, or the server IP address.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/BBxServlet/BBxServletRequest/BBxServletRequest_getServerName.htm)

methods.name: getServerPort
methods.docu: In BBj 21.00 and higher, this method returns the port number to which the request was sent. It is the value of the part after ":" in the Host header value, if any, or the server port where the client connection was accepted on.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/BBxServlet/BBxServletRequest/BBxServletRequest_getServerPort.htm)

methods.name: getServletPath
methods.docu:
In BBj 21.00 and higher, this method returns the part of this request's URL that calls the servlet. This path starts with a "/" character and includes either the servlet name or a path to the servlet, but does not include any extra path information or a query string. Same as the value of the CGI variable SCRIPT_NAME.
                                            This method will return an empty string ("") if the servlet used to process this request was matched using the "/*" pattern.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/BBxServlet/BBxServletRequest/BBxServletRequest_getServletPath.htm)

methods.name: getSession
methods.docu: In BBj 21.00 and higher, this method returns the BBxWebSession of the BBxServlet.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/BBxServlet/BBxServletRequest/BBxServletRequest_getSession.htm)

methods.name: isRequestedSessionIdFromCookie
methods.docu: In BBj 21.00 and higher, this method checks whether the requested session ID came in as a cookie.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/BBxServlet/BBxServletRequest/BBxServletRequest_isRequestedSessionIdFromCookie.htm)

methods.name: isRequestedSessionIdFromURL
methods.docu: In BBj 21.00 and higher, this method checks whether the requested session ID came in as part of the request URL.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/BBxServlet/BBxServletRequest/BBxServletRequest_isRequestedSessionIdFromURL.htm)

methods.name: isRequestedSessionIdValid
methods.docu:
In BBj 21.00 and higher, this method checks whether the requested session ID is still valid.
                                            If the client did not specify any session ID, this method returns false.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/BBxServlet/BBxServletRequest/BBxServletRequest_isRequestedSessionIdValid.htm)

methods.name: isSecure
methods.docu: In BBj 21.00 and higher, this method returns a boolean indicating whether this request was made using a secure channel, such as HTTPS.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/BBxServlet/BBxServletRequest/BBxServletRequest_isSecure.htm)

methods.name: removeAttribute
methods.docu: In BBj 21.00 and higher, this method removes an attribute from this request.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/BBxServlet/BBxServletRequest/BBxServletRequest_removeAttribute.htm)

methods.name: setAttribute
methods.docu:
In BBj 21.00 and higher, this method stores an attribute in this request. Attributes are reset between requests.
                                            If the object passed in is null, the effect is the same as calling removeAttribute(String).[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/BBxServlet/BBxServletRequest/BBxServletRequest_setAttribute.htm)

classes.name: BBxServletResponse
classes.docu: In BBj 21.00 and higher, this class provides HTTP-specific functionality in sending a response for a BBxServlet. For example, it has methods to access HTTP headers and cookies. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/BBxServlet/BBxServletResponse/BBxServletResponse.htm)

methods.name: addCookie
methods.docu: In BBj 21.00 and higher, this method adds the given BBjCookie to the BBxServlet. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/BBxServlet/BBxServletResponse/BBxServletResponse_addCookie.htm)

methods.name: addHeader
methods.docu: In BBj 21.00 and higher, this method adds a header with the given name and value to the BBxServlet. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/BBxServlet/BBxServletResponse/BBxServletResponse_addHeader.htm)

methods.name: containsHeader
methods.docu: In BBj 21.00 and higher, this method checks if the BBxServletResponse contains the specified header. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/BBxServlet/BBxServletResponse/BBxServletResponse_containsHeader.htm)

methods.name: createCookie
methods.docu: In BBj 21.00 and higher, this method creates and returns a new BBjCookie with the specified name. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/BBxServlet/BBxServletResponse/BBxServletResponse_createCookie.htm)

methods.name: encodeRedirectURL
methods.docu: In BBj 21.00 and higher, this method encodes the specified URL for use in the sendRedirect method or, if encoding is not needed, returns the URL unchanged. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/BBxServlet/BBxServletResponse/BBxServletResponse_encodeRedirectURL.htm)

methods.name: encodeURL
methods.docu: In BBj 21.00 and higher, this method encodes the specified URL by including the session ID in it, or, if encoding is not needed, returns the URL unchanged. The implementation of this method includes the logic to determine whether the session ID needs to be encoded in the URL. For example, if the browser supports cookies, or session tracking is turned off, URL encoding is unnecessary. For robust session tracking, all URLs emitted by a servlet should be run through this method. Otherwise, URL rewriting cannot be used with browsers which do not support cookies. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/BBxServlet/BBxServletResponse/BBxServletResponse_encodeURL.htm)

methods.name: flushBuffer
methods.docu: In BBj 21.00 and higher, this method forces any content in the buffer to be written to the client. A call to this method automatically commits the response, meaning the status code and headers will be written. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/BBxServlet/BBxServletResponse/BBxServletResponse_flushBuffer.htm)

methods.name: getCharacterEncoding
methods.docu: In BBj 21.00 and higher, this method returns the name of the character encoding (MIME charset) used for the body sent in this response. The character encoding may have been specified explicitly using the setCharacterEncoding(java.lang.String) or setContentType(java.lang.String) methods, or implicitly using the setLocale(java.util.Locale) method. Explicit specifications take precedence over implicit specifications. Calls made to these methods after getWriter has been called or after the response has been committed have no effect on the character encoding. If no character encoding has been specified, ISO-8859-1 is returned. See RFC 2047 (https://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc2047.txt) for more information about character encoding and MIME. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/BBxServlet/BBxServletResponse/BBxServletResponse_getCharacterEncoding.htm)

methods.name: getContentType
methods.docu: In BBj 21.00 and higher, this method returns the content type used for the MIME body sent in this response. The content type proper must have been specified using setContentType(java.lang.String) before the response is committed. If no content type has been specified, this method returns null. If a content type has been specified, and a character encoding has been explicitly or implicitly specified as described in getCharacterEncoding() or getWriter() has been called, the charset parameter is included in the string returned. If no character encoding has been specified, the charset parameter is omitted. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/BBxServlet/BBxServletResponse/BBxServletResponse_getContentType.htm)

methods.name: getHeader
methods.docu: In BBj 21.00 and higher, this method gets the value of the response header with the given name. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/BBxServlet/BBxServletResponse/BBxServletResponse_getHeader.htm)

methods.name: getHeaderNames
methods.docu: In BBj 21.00 and higher, this method returns a BBjVector of all header names for the BBxServlet. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/BBxServlet/BBxServletResponse/BBxServletResponse_getHeaderNames.htm)

methods.name: getHeaders
methods.docu: In BBj 21.00 and higher, this method creates a BBjVector of all values of the header with the given name. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/BBxServlet/BBxServletResponse/BBxServletResponse_getHeaders.htm)

methods.name: getHttpServletResponse
methods.docu: In BBj 21.00 and higher, this method returns the underlying javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse object of the BBxServletResponse. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/BBxServlet/BBxServletResponse/BBxServletResponse_getHttpServletResponse.htm)

methods.name: getLocale
methods.docu: In BBj 21.00 and higher, this method returns the locale specified for this response using the setLocale method. Calls made to setLocale after the response is committed have no effect. If no locale has been specified, the container's default locale is returned. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/BBxServlet/BBxServletResponse/BBxServletResponse_getLocale.htm)

methods.name: getOutputStream
methods.docu: In BBj 21.00 and higher, this method returns a ServletOutputStream suitable for writing binary data in the response. The servlet container does not encode the binary data. Calling flush() on the ServletOutputStream commits the response. Either this method or getWriter() may be called to write the body, not both. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/BBxServlet/BBxServletResponse/BBxServletResponse_getOutputStream.htm)

methods.name: getStatus
methods.docu: In BBj 21.00 and higher, this method gets the current status code of this response. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/BBxServlet/BBxServletResponse/BBxServletResponse_getStatus.htm)

methods.name: isCommitted
methods.docu: In BBj 21.00 and higher, this method returns a boolean indicating if the response has been committed. A committed response has already had its status code and headers written. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/BBxServlet/BBxServletResponse/BBxServletResponse_isCommitted.htm)

methods.name: reset
methods.docu: In BBj 21.00 and higher, this method clears any data that exists in the buffer as well as the status code and headers. If the response has been committed, this method throws an IllegalStateException. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/BBxServlet/BBxServletResponse/BBxServletResponse_reset.htm)

methods.name: resetBuffer
methods.docu: In BBj 21.00 and higher, this method clears the content of the underlying buffer in the response without clearing headers or status code. If the response has been committed, this method throws an IllegalStateException. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/BBxServlet/BBxServletResponse/BBxServletResponse_resetBuffer.htm)

methods.name: sendError
methods.docu: In BBj 21.00 and higher, this method sends an error response to the client using the specified status and clears the buffer. The server defaults to creating the response to look like an HTML-formatted server error page containing the specified message, setting the content type to "text/html". The server will preserve cookies and may clear or update any headers needed to serve the error page as a valid response. If an error-page declaration has been made for the web application corresponding to the status code passed in, it will be served back in preference to the suggested message parameter and the message parameter will be ignored. If the response has already been committed, this method throws an IllegalStateException. After using this method, the response should be considered to be committed and should not be written to. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/BBxServlet/BBxServletResponse/BBxServletResponse_sendError.htm)

methods.name: sendError
methods.docu: In BBj 21.00 and higher, this method sends an error response to the client using the specified status and clears the buffer. The server defaults to creating the response to look like an HTML-formatted server error page containing the specified message, setting the content type to "text/html". The server will preserve cookies and may clear or update any headers needed to serve the error page as a valid response. If an error-page declaration has been made for the web application corresponding to the status code passed in, it will be served back in preference to the suggested message parameter and the message parameter will be ignored. If the response has already been committed, this method throws an IllegalStateException. After using this method, the response should be considered to be committed and should not be written to. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/BBxServlet/BBxServletResponse/BBxServletResponse_sendError.htm)

methods.name: sendRedirect
methods.docu: In BBj 21.00 and higher, this method sends a temporary redirect response to the client using the specified redirect location URL and clears the buffer. The buffer will be replaced with the data set by this method. Calling this method sets the status code to SC_FOUND 302 (Found). This method can accept relative URLs; the servlet container must convert the relative URL to an absolute URL before sending the response to the client. If the location is relative without a leading '/' the container interprets it as relative to the current request URI. If the location is relative with a leading '/' the container interprets it as relative to the servlet container root. If the response has already been committed, this method throws an IllegalStateException. After using this method, the response should be considered to be committed and should not be written to. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/BBxServlet/BBxServletResponse/BBxServletResponse_sendRedirect.htm)

methods.name: setBufferSize
methods.docu: In BBj 21.00 and higher, this method sets the preferred buffer size for the body of the response. The servlet container will use a buffer at least as large as the size requested. The actual buffer size used can be found using getBufferSize. A larger buffer allows more content to be written before anything is actually sent, thus providing the servlet with more time to set appropriate status codes and headers. A smaller buffer decreases server memory load and allows the client to start receiving data more quickly. This method must be called before any response body content is written; if content has been written or the response object has been committed, this method throws an IllegalStateException. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/BBxServlet/BBxServletResponse/BBxServletResponse_setBufferSize.htm)

methods.name: setCharacterEncoding
methods.docu: In BBj 21.00 and higher, this method sets the character encoding (MIME charset) of the response being sent to the client (for example, to UTF-8). If the character encoding has already been set by setContentType(java.lang.String) or setLocale(java.util.Locale), this method overrides it. Calling setContentType(java.lang.String) with the String of text/html and calling this method with the String of UTF-8 is equivalent with calling setContentType with the String of text/html; charset=UTF-8. This method can be called repeatedly to change the character encoding. This method has no effect if it is called after getWriter has been called or after the response has been committed. Containers must communicate the character encoding used for the servlet response's writer to the client if the protocol provides a way for doing so. In the case of HTTP, the character encoding is communicated as part of the Content-Type header for text media types. Note that the character encoding cannot be communicated via HTTP headers if the servlet does not specify a content type; however, it is still used to encode text written via the servlet response's writer. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/BBxServlet/BBxServletResponse/BBxServletResponse_setCharacterEncoding.htm)

methods.name: setContentLength
methods.docu: In BBj 21.00 and higher, this method sets the length of the content body in the response. In HTTP servlets, this method sets the HTTP Content-Length header.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/BBxServlet/BBxServletResponse/BBxServletResponse_setContentLength.htm)

methods.name: setContentType
methods.docu: In BBj 21.00 and higher, this method sets the content type of the response being sent to the client, if the response has not been committed yet. The given content type may include a character encoding specification, for example, text/html;charset=UTF-8. The response's character encoding is only set from the given content type if this method is called before getWriter is called. This method may be called repeatedly to change content type and character encoding. This method has no effect if called after the response has been committed. It does not set the response's character encoding if it is called after getWriter has been called or after the response has been committed. Containers must communicate the content type and the character encoding used for the servlet response's writer to the client if the protocol provides a way for doing so. In the case of HTTP, the Content-Type header is used. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/BBxServlet/BBxServletResponse/BBxServletResponse_setContentType.htm)

methods.name: setDateHeader
methods.docu: In BBj 21.00 and higher, this method sets a response header with the given name and date-value. The date is specified in terms of milliseconds since the epoch. If the header had already been set, the new value overwrites the previous one. The containsHeader method can be used to test for the presence of a header before setting its value. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/BBxServlet/BBxServletResponse/BBxServletResponse_setDateHeader.htm)

methods.name: setHeader
methods.docu: In BBj 21.00 and higher, this method sets a response header with the given name and value. If the header has already been set, the new value overwrites the previous one. The containsHeader method can be used to test for the presence of a header before setting its value. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/BBxServlet/BBxServletResponse/BBxServletResponse_setHeader.htm)

methods.name: setLocale
methods.docu: In BBj 21.00 and higher, this method sets the locale of the response, if the response has not been committed yet. It also sets the response's character encoding appropriately for the locale, if the character encoding has not been explicitly set using setContentType(java.lang.String) or setCharacterEncoding(java.lang.String), getWriter hasn't been called yet, and the response hasn't been committed yet. If the deployment descriptor contains a locale-encoding-mapping-list element, and that element provides a mapping for the given locale, that mapping is used. Otherwise, the mapping from locale to character encoding is container dependent. This method may be called repeatedly to change locale and character encoding. The method has no effect if called after the response has been committed. It does not set the response's character encoding if it is called after setContentType(java.lang.String) has been called with a charset specification, after setCharacterEncoding(java.lang.String) has been called, after getWriter has been called, or after the response has been committed. Containers must communicate the locale and the character encoding used for the servlet response's writer to the client if the protocol provides a way for doing so. In the case of HTTP, the locale is communicated via the Content-Language header, the character encoding as part of the Content-Type header for text media types. Note that the character encoding cannot be communicated via HTTP headers if the servlet does not specify a content type; however, it is still used to encode text written via the servlet response's writer. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/BBxServlet/BBxServletResponse/BBxServletResponse_setLocale.htm)

methods.name: setStatus
methods.docu: In BBj 21.00 and higher, this method sets the status code for this response. This method is used to set the return status code when there is no error (for example, for the SC_OK or SC_MOVED_TEMPORARILY status codes). If this method is used to set an error code, then the container's error page mechanism will not be triggered. If there is an error and the caller wishes to invoke an error page defined in the web application, then sendError(int, String) must be used instead. This method preserves any cookies and other response headers. Valid status codes are those in the 2XX, 3XX, 4XX, and 5XX ranges. Other status codes are treated as container specific. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/BBxServlet/BBxServletResponse/BBxServletResponse_setStatus.htm)

classes.name: BBxWebSession
classes.docu:
In BBj 21.00 and higher, the BBxWebSession object provides a way for a BBxServlet to identify a user across more than one page request or visit to a Web site and to store information about that user. The BBxServlet uses this object to create a session between a client and a server. The session persists for a specified time period, across more than one connection or page request from the user. A session usually corresponds to one user, who may visit a site many times. The server can maintain a session in many ways such as using cookies or rewriting URLs. This class allows BBxServlets to:
  • View and manipulate information about a session, such as the session identifier, creation time, and last accessed time
  • Bind objects to sessions, allowing user information to persist across multiple user connections
A servlet should be able to handle cases in which the client does not choose to join a session, such as when cookies are intentionally turned off. Until the client joins the session, isNew returns true. If the client chooses not to join the session, getSession will return a different session on each request, and isNew() will always return true. Session information is scoped only to the current web application (BBxServletContext), so information stored in one context will not be directly visible in another. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/BBxServlet/BBxWebSession/BBxWebSession.htm)

methods.name: getAttribute
methods.docu: In BBj 21.00 and higher, this method returns the value of the specified attribute for the BBxWebSession.[Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/BBxServlet/BBxWebSession/BBxWebSession_getAttribute.htm)

methods.name: getAttributeNames
methods.docu: In BBj 21.00 and higher, this method returns a BBjVector of all the attribute names for the BBxWebSession. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/BBxServlet/BBxWebSession/BBxWebSession_getAttributeNames.htm)

methods.name: getCreationTime
methods.docu: In BBj 21.00 and higher, this method returns the creation time of the BBxWebSession. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/BBxServlet/BBxWebSession/BBxWebSession_getCreationTime.htm)

methods.name: getId
methods.docu: In BBj 21.00 and higher, this method returns a String containing the unique identifier assigned to this BBxWebSession. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/BBxServlet/BBxWebSession/BBxWebSession_getId.htm)

methods.name: getLastAccessedTime
methods.docu: In BBj 21.00 and higher, this method returns the last time the client sent a request associated with this BBxWebSession, marked by the time the request was received. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/BBxServlet/BBxWebSession/BBxWebSession_getLastAccessedTime.htm)

methods.name: getMaxInactiveInterval
methods.docu: In BBj 21.00 and higher, this method returns the maximum time interval, in seconds, that the BBxServlet will keep this BBxWebSession open between client accesses. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/BBxServlet/BBxWebSession/BBxWebSession_getMaxInactiveInterval.htm)

methods.name: invalidate
methods.docu: In BBj 21.00 and higher, this method invalidates this BBxWebSession, then unbinds any objects bound to it. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/BBxServlet/BBxWebSession/BBxWebSession_invalidate.htm)

methods.name: isNew
methods.docu: In BBj 21.00 and higher, this method returns true if the client does not yet know about the BBxWebSession, or if the client chooses not to join the BBxWebSession. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/BBxServlet/BBxWebSession/BBxWebSession_isNew.htm)

methods.name: removeAttribute
methods.docu: In BBj 21.00 and higher, this method removes the specified attribute for the BBxWebSession. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/BBxServlet/BBxWebSession/BBxWebSession_removeAttribute.htm)

methods.name: setAttribute
methods.docu: In BBj 21.00 and higher, this method returns the value of the specified attribute for the BBxWebSession. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/BBxServlet/BBxWebSession/BBxWebSession_setAttribute.htm)

methods.name: setMaxInactiveInterval
methods.docu: In BBj 21.00 and higher, this method sets the time, in seconds, between client requests before the BBxServlet invalidates this BBxWebSession. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/BBxServlet/BBxWebSession/BBxWebSession_setMaxInactiveInterval.htm)

methods.name: getContext
methods.docu: In BBj 21.00 and higher, this method returns the BBjJettyContext object for the BBxWebSession. [Docs](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/BBxServlet/BBxWebSession/BBxWebSession_getContext.htm)
